title: Calories in 90/10 Hamburger Meat
meta_description: Discover calories in hamburger meat 90 10 per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and cooking tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Raw ground beef, 90% lean / 10% fat, no added seasonings or binders.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, fat content accuracy, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of 90/10 hamburger meat provides ~176 kcal and ~20g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp vegetable oil per 100g when cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of 90/10 hamburger meat?
faqs.a: About 176 kcal for raw 90/10 ground beef.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in hamburger meat 90 10?
Does cooking change calories in 90/10 hamburger meat?
faqs.a: Yes, cooking methods like broiling can reduce calories by draining fat, down to ~150-160 kcal per 100g.

faqs.q: What does 90/10 mean for hamburger meat?
faqs.a: 90% lean meat and 10% fat content, making it a leaner option for burgers or patties.

faqs.q: How much fat is in 90/10 hamburger meat per serving?
faqs.a: About 10g total fat per 100g, with 4g saturated.
